title: Strategies for Utilizing Social Networking Sites in Ubiquitous Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary smartphone usage skills and online learning platform experience
context.additional_context: Designed to enable professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to effectively utilize ubiquitous learning tools in elementary science education. Activity structures optimized for smartphone-centric limited technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can enhance collective efficacy by over 80% through collaborative problem-solving processes with peers using social networking sites.
Learners can achieve a score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point Likert scale in perceived usefulness and ease of use of social networking tools through TAM (Technology Acceptance Model)-based evaluations.
Learners can successfully perform science experiment design and data-sharing processes three or more times by integrating social networking features in a VR simulation environment.

resources: Free Social Networking Tools (e.g., Telegram, Padlet)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
